content.name: p
children: As a developer, you can use devfile attributes to configure various features and properties according to the needs of users and tools. Attributes are implementation-dependent and written in free-form YAML.

content.name: p
children: Attributes can be defined at the top level of the devfile, or in the following objects:

children.name: li
children: : Attributes in metadata are deprecated. Use top-level attributes instead.

children.name: Fence
children:
----
schemaVersion: 2.0.0
metadata:
  name: java-quarkus
...
components:  
  - name: outerloop-deploy
    attributes:
      deployment/replicas: 1
      deployment/cpuLimit: "100m"
      deployment/cpuRequest: 10m
      deployment/memoryLimit: 250Mi
      deployment/memoryRequest: 100Mi
      deployment/container-port: 8081
    kubernetes:
      uri: outerloop-deploy.yaml
----

  attributes:
    editorFree: true
components:

    kubernetes:
